p_1: Rondo was an early attempt at a motion graphics-based animation using a strings-based score and minimal black and white graphics.
p_3: Aside for the more basic shapes such as ellipses and rectangles, I used vectored assets from Illustrator and animated their transformation properties. The entire animation was kept in 2D. To make scenes smoother, I parented graphics to a null object and used the null as a camera for the scene, such as in panning and zooming.
d_4: Using a null object to zoom into multiple shapes
p_5: The repeater function helped a lot, allowing me to repeat vectors with ease to make systems more populated and complicated. I used the repeater's animation offset feature to delay the animation for successive repeated objects.
p_6: I used a paint splatter asset library for the paint splatter effect. The splatters came as jpegs, where I would animate the scale to make it look like they were just created.
